title: meghan markles 11k good vibes
story: Meghan Markles £.k good vibes bracelet thats said to ward off undesired energyDuring an appearance at a virtual summit, Meghan Markle wore the £, diamond-studded piece called the Eye of Protection bracelet, pairing it with her sleek black outfitMeghan during an appearance at online summit Image: New York Times DealBookByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle often pairs her outfits with intricate pieces of jewellery that have hidden meanings. And during her appearance at a virtual summit earlier this week, it appears that she wore a stunning diamond bracelet thataposs meant to attract good vibes only.On Tuesday, Meghan spoke at the New York Times DealBook conference, where she wore a sleek all-black outfit.She paired it with an aposEye of Protectionapos bracelet, reports Page Six, which is by jewellery brand Mateo and comes in around £,.According to the Mateo website, the piece is made from -carat gold and is hand-painted with enamel by skilled artisans.  And the brand adds: Ward off undesired energy with this bracelet and attract good vibes only. However, itaposs not the first time Meghan has worn jewellery meant to keep bad energy at bay. She has also been seen wearing an Edge of Ember pendant, which has a gorgeous blue topaz stone and is said to protect its wearer from negative vibes. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.In addition, sheaposs also donned an Alemdara Hamsa necklace, which features the hand of Hamsa that is said to ward off negativity.Meghanaposs appearance at the New York Times event was her first in-person interview since she and Prince Harryaposs tell-all on the Oprah Winfrey show in March. Speaking to host Andrew Ross Sorkin, she said stepping back from royal duties had led to an improvement in her mental health.Mr Sorkin said there was a moment when a lot of the world was concerned and wondering about the comments she made in the Oprah interview. But the Duchess replied: Iaposm feeling much better about everything, thank you.  She also called for a aposdislikeapos button to be introduced on Instagram, highlighting the fact that Instagram has a like button and the ability to comment, but not a aposdislikeapos option. The online chat came a day before she joined husband Prince Harry at the Salute to Freedom Gala at the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum in New York - hours after new evidence was heard in her privacy court case in London.Comment MORE ON Meghan MarkleRoyal FamilyJewellery" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news meghan-markles-dad-says-harry-"Thomas Markle says he is disappointed with Prince HarryByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov | comments Thomas Markle says Prince Harry should have asked him for permission to marry his daughter Meghan and he was disappointed it didnapost happen.Meghan and her father have had a fraught relationship in recent years with Thomas cut out of her le and reportedly never meeting the Sussexes’ children Achie and Lilibet. Thomas has been critical about Meghan and Harry and once again fired an attack at them in an interview where he criticised the Duke of Sussex before the  royal wedding. He claims he invited Meghan and Harry to his home in Mexico several times but they never took him up on his offer.  Thomas told GB News: “I’m very disappointed that Harry, wanting to marry my daughter, wouldn’t have had the good sense to come down here and ask for her hand. Someone who is royalty I would think would want to go by the book and do things properly but apparently it didn’t matter to him so that was a disappointment as well.” Thomas said he wanted to play a role in the lives of Meghan and Harry and his two grandchildren. “I certainly always want my family especially now the older I get the more I need my family, he said.  The father and daughter have reportedly not been on speaking terms since Thomas staged a photo shoot for press before his daughter got married to Harry in . He did not attend the wedding after having a heart attack and needing surgery. Mr Markle last appeared on British TV screens at the end of October when he was interviewed on Good Morning Britain. During the attack on the Sussexes, Thomas claimed he was being ghosted by Meghan and has vowed to continue to publicly attack his daughter until she begins speaking to him again. I think Harry has abandoned the Queen, the royal family, the British people and the Army. Heaposs abandoned them all, he said on GMB. title: one food you should eat
story: One food you should eat twice a week to help you avoid high cholesterolHigh cholesterol is an important problem in the UK with its connection to coronary heart disease and here are some foods and other tips to keep it under controlCertain foods work well in reducing peoples high cholesterol Image: Getty ImagesBySarah BarrettTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsBrits are being warned of the dangers from high cholesterol with statistics showing a worrying number of over s in this position and here are some foods and tips to reduce it. Statistics from the British Heart Foundation show that every eight minutes somebody dies from coronary heart disease and the importance to take steps to keep the organ healthy.High cholesterol is extremely common and it increases your risk of heart attack and disease, so it is crucial to keep it at a healthy level, reported the Irish Mirror.For good heart health and healthy cholesterol, the BHF recommends people have a diet with fruit and vegetables, and less fatty food.  What is High Cholesterol  Cholesterol is a type of fat found in your blood which is made in the body mainly by the liver and it is needed for all body cells to produce important hormones. Butthere is too much cholesterol in your blood, it sticks to your artery walls to form atheroma or plaque. This build-up on the artery walls means your arteries become narrowed and this process also called the hardening of the arteries. If an artery supplying the heart muscle becomes blocked completely, the muscle becomes damaged and this is known as a heart attack. Similarlyan artery to the brain is completely blocked, it damages the brain and this is called a stroke.  Symptoms of High Cholesterol High cholesterol in itself does not usually cause symptoms but the build-up of fatty material on the artery walls and the narrowing does leave to ious conditions and these depend on where the blockage occurs.Angina Acute coronary syndrome Heart attackthe heart is affected Stroke or TIAthe brain is affected Leg pain and intermittent pain when walkingthe peripheral arteries are affected.The body can produce all the cholesterol it needs and can usually maintain a healthy level of blood cholesterol. Good cholesterolHDL cholesterol is called good cholesterol or healthy cholesterol because it mops up cholesterol left behind in your arteries and carries it to your liver where it is broken down and passed out of your body. Regular physical activity and exercise can help increase your HDL level but problems arise when the balance goes wrong and there is an increase in bad cholesterol called LDL. This may result from inherited problems or from eating too much saturatedfat or too many foods from the top shelf of the Food Pyramid.  Bad cholesterolLDL cholesterol travels from your liver through your arteries to other parts of your body. LDL is called bad cholesterol because it sticks to the walls in your arteries - making them narrow. Prevention If you want to prevent high cholesterol here are some things you can do.You should have regular blood pressure and cholesterol checks with your doctor. Eat more fruit and vegetables and wholegrain foods Eat less fatty foods Eat fish twice a week including oily fish If you smoke, try to stop Be a healthy weight Be more physically active for at least  minutes  days a week Drink less alcohol Learn to relax, de-stress – take time out for yourself.Comment MORE ON Blood pressureHeart attackHeart diseaseFitnessCholesterol" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: pensioner left scaffolding around house
story: Pensioner left with scaffolding around house after free renovation abandonedJudith Chamberlain, of Beeston, has told how E.On have abandoned insulation work that comes as part of a government grant scheme and left scaffolding around her homeJudith Chamberlain, of Beeston, has told how she has been left with scaffolding around her homeByJoel MooreTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA pensioner says utility firm E.On started insulation work on her home and then abandoned it, leaving scaffolding around the house.Judith Chamberlain, of Beeston, said that the scaffolding has now been left for more than a month as well as building materials in her garden, reported NottinghamshireLive.She said she was left frustrated and deflated by the situation especially after receiving a government grant for the improvements in the first place. Iaposm back to square one, basically, she said. I felt pretty deflated, but I suppose this is le. Itaposs been a bit of a journey really. Itaposll be a relief to get the scaffolding down and then Iaposll be able to resurrect my garden.  Ms Chamberlain said scaffolding was put up around her home in early October, with alterations to be made to external pipework and building materials put in her front and back gardens. By the end of the month I was told that the project had ended, she continued. God knows how much government money has been wasted in the process. Ms Chamberlain was due to have external wall insulation for free after she successfully applied for a Green Homes Grant, a scheme funded by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy. The grants have been handed out and the work is being carried out in phases. Ms Chamberlain applied for a grant in March, but she claims E.On said they would be unable to finish the work before a deadline at the end of October. The company said this was due to the fact they were trying to complete work for as many homes as possible in the window after applications closed on March . E.On said they had apologised to Ms Chamberlain and would remove the building materials and fix the pipework as a matter of urgency. A spokesperson told NottinghamshireLive: Unfortunately it wasn’t possible to complete the external wall insulation at this property under the government-led Green Homes Grant Local Authority Delivery scheme before this phase of it closed. We have made the council’s local co-ordinator for this work across Nottinghamshire aware of this case so the insulation can be completed within a future phase of the scheme.” Ms Chamberlain said that she believed she was not the only homeowner to fall foul of the timeout. E.On said they have provided  energy efficiency measures to  Nottinghamshire households at a government-funded cost of £,. news uk-news prince-charles-gives-well-wishers-"Prince Charles tells well-wishers the Queen is all rightByLaura ElstonAlice Peacock:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsPrince Charles reassured a bystander about the health of the Queen as he met members of the public in London. The Prince of Wales was greeted by crowds of people as he left a branch of NatWest bank in Brixton, south London, after an engagement for the Princeaposs Trust on Thursday. One man asked him: Prince Charles. How is your mother  The heir to the throne gave him an encouraging pat on the arm, and appeared to say: Sheaposs alright, thank you. The Queen, , has been under doctorsapos orders to rest during the past three weeks after undergoing medical tests and spending a night in hospital on October . She has ed to Windsor Castle on Tuesday after spending six days at Sandringham, where she was believed to have been preparing to welcome her family for Christmas. She conducted a Privy Council meeting by video link from the castle on Wednesday afternoon, with ministers including Lord President of the Council Jacob Rees-Mogg and Education Secretary Nadhim Zahawi among others.The -year-old monarch is understood to be feeling refreshed after spending time at her later husband Prince Philipaposs former home, Wood Farm on the vast Sandringham estate. Though the monarch has said she will miss the annual Festival of Remembrance at the Royal Albert Hall on Saturday, Buckingham Palace has said it is her firm intention to be at the Remembrance Sunday service at the Cenotaph. However, her attendance has yet to be confirmed. The Queen is commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces and has only ever missed six Remembrance Sunday services in the capital, four due to royal tours and two when she was pregnant.  The Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall are expected to lead other members of the royal family on Saturday at the annual remembrance event at the Royal Albert Hall. This would include the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, the Earl and Countess of Wessex and the Princess Royal. Her Majesty has been told to ease up on her hectic schedule after she was last month forced to spend a night in hospital, with specialist doctors at the King Edward VII hospital in Marylebone, London, performing a series of tests described as “preliminary investigations”.  She was forced to cancel a two day trip to Northern Ireland at the last minute as well as a planned appearance at the COP climate change conference last week. Courtiers are understood to be working towards managing the Queen’s diary accordingly for the next few weeks leading up to Christmas, while she will continue to undertake light duties at Windsor Castle. In a statement, Buckingham Palace said: Following on from their recent advice that the Queen should rest for a few days, Her Majestyaposs doctors have advised that she should continue to rest for at least the next two weeks.  The doctors have advised that Her Majesty can continue to undertake light, desk-based duties during this time, including some virtual audiences, but not to undertake any official visits. The monarch has recently been spotted used a walking stick for the first time on royal visits. Despite any recent medical wobbles, the monarch is said to be “totally committed” to entertaining her loved ones at her Norfolk home after missing out last year because of the pandemic. But royal sources said she is determined to recover soon so she can see her family at their traditional festive gathering. Last year restrictions meant the Queen and the late Prince Philip had a quiet Christmas alone at Windsor Castle. But after losing her husband of  years in April, it is understood Her Majesty really wants to see everyone together. A Palace insider said: “This year, more than ever, it is incredibly important to Her Majesty to be surrounded by her loved ones. “The Queen is totally committed to hosting everyone as she hopes to make it back to full health in the coming weeks. “Her Majesty is resting under doctors’ orders with the intention of being able to fully enjoy the company of her extended family over the holiday period. title: schoolgirl 11 who woke up
story: Schoolgirl, , who woke up with a belly ache dies just three weeks laterJohn Woods daughter, Carly, was taken to hospital after she started to feel worse and doctors gave her family a devastating diagnosis - she had a rare form of liver cancerCarly Woods died just three weeks after complaining to her parents she had a belly acheByLee Grimsditch:,  Nov | commentsA schoolgirl who woke up one day with a stomach ache died just three weeks later, her devastated father says. John Woodsapos -year-old daughter, Carly, had been playing outside with her friends and brothers and was her aposnormal happy selfapos the day before she felt unwell. She was taken to hospital after she started to feel worse and doctors gave her family a devastating diagnosis - she had a rare form of liver cancer.Her liver was four times larger than it should have been and it was ram packed and stuffed with multiple tumours, John, , told the Liverpool Echo. Carly, whose family lives in Skelmersdale, died on November  at Alder Hey Childrenaposs Hospital.  John, who lives in with his partner, Kelly [Carlyaposs mum], and their children, said: She woke up on the Sunday morning and said, aposdad, Iaposve got a belly acheapos. I was putting clothes away and I just said, wellyouaposre trying to get out of school Iaposm still sending you. It was her first year in senior school and she was having a bit of trouble settling in. I thought she was trying to play on it. As the day went on she was moaning a little bit more and I asked her what sheaposd had for her breakfast this morning. She said she wasnapost really hungry. I said youaposve probably got hunger pains, get downstairs and Iaposll do you your dinner.  I did her something to eat but she didnapost really eat much of it. It got to bed time and she was whimpering a little bit so Kelly just gave her some Ibuprofen. Kelly come back in the bedroom and said I think she might have appendicitis. I said weaposll see how she gets on tomorrow morning. At five oaposclock in the morning, my partner wakes me and says can you take the day off and watch the baby, Iaposm going to take her to the hospital. Carly was taken to Ormskirk Hospital where she underwent scans and tests. Appendicitis was ruled out but the parents were told their daughteraposs liver was bigger than it should be and doctors didnapost understand the reason why. Carly was in hospital for four days undergoing more tests until she was eventually transferred to Alder Hey. It was there that further scans prompted doctors to break some devastating news to her parents. John said: I was called into the office and the doctor told me that straight away they could see on the ultrasound her liver was four times larger than it should be and it was just ram packed and stuffed with multiple tumours. John said the news left them in shock but worse was to come as further tests showed that the cancer had spread to the little girlaposs lungs.  Carly had been diagnosed with a rare type of liver cancer called aposhepatocellular neoplasm not otherwise specied HC-NOSapos. John said: They said they only see one or two of these cancers each year and normally thereaposs some sort of pre-warning, usually the kid has been in hospital or been sick before. Doctors told the parents they would need to administer an invasive and experimental form of chemotherapy immediately to rid Carlyaposs lungs of tumours before she would be able to have a liver transplant. Surgery was performed to prepare Carly for the chemotherapy by inserting a line in the side of her neck, but afterwards doctors were having trouble bringing her around. After she eventually woke up, Carlyaposs parents were told they would have to get her salt levels higher before they could administer the treatment and so the parents went home for the night.  The next day, a doctor called them both back into the hospital. John said: We went back in on the Sunday morning and they told us there was medically nothing they could do. Her liver was pretty much clapped out and not ing. She wouldnapost physically be able to take the chemotherapy, it would be too cruel. They told us that we would have to make the decision to not resuscitate her and just keep her comfortable and let her pass. Carly lived for another week before she died, surrounded by her loving parents, on November . John said: I think for both of us itaposs not even sunk in yet. Iaposm still numb. The only thing thataposs getting me through it is making it [Carlyaposs funeral] the best day possible for her.The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Weaposre having horses and carriages with the horses dressed as unicorns because that was one of her favourite things. She was a bubbly little girl. Everyone knew her for having wild hair. She always had a smile on her face and her teachers said to me she was always complimenting somebody. The grieving dad said the thing thataposs giving them comfort at this time, is knowing that samples taken from Carly may help other children. John added: I hope Carlyaposs memory and story will be seen by thousands and her sacrice will potentially save thousands of familyaposs from the same heart ache and fate in the future. news uk-news shocking-moment-driver--seen-"Shocking cctv of driver flying over bridge before killing grandadByHarry Leach:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Shocking CCTV footage shows the moment an unqualied driver lost control of a stolen car before “flying” over a bridge and killing a pedestrian. Raihan Ahmed, , was driving mph in a mph zone across a bridge in Birmingham’s Digbeth district on August . The stolen caraposs wheels at one point left the ground before landing on the other side of the bridge, smashing into -year-old former bus driver and father-of-four Ghulam Nabi, who died of his injuries.Police have released the CCTV video clips, which show Ahmed fleeing the scene at high speed before abandoning the car, BirminghamLive reports. Ahmed, of Great Barr, was arrested just  hours later following a successful appeal by the police and jailed for three-years and eight months.  He has been banned from driving for four years and ten months. The family of the victim, Mr Nabi, agreed for police to release the footage to warn drivers over the dangers of speeding. West Midlands Police detective Paul Hughes, of the forceaposs serious collision investigation unit said, “Mr Nabi was a totally innocent party in this matter and, as a pedestrian, should have been afforded safety on the pavement.  Ahmed was driving at such a speed on a public road and, in a specically restricted speed limit, that the loss of control on the bridge resulted in all four wheels leaving the road. “Itaposs always a dficult decision to release footage from such tragic cases - however this is some of the worse driving I have seen in a long time. “By releasing footage, with the support of Mr Nabi’s family, I hope it will make people think again about the responsibility they carry when driving. A split second decision can mean the dference between le or death.” Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Paul HughesWest Midlands PoliceCCTVEducationHospitalsCCTV footageDriving banDangerous driving" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: single mum two living abandoned
story: Single mum-of-two living in abandoned block with kids sleeps with kne under bedThe tenant, who is a survivor of domestic abuse and has asked for anonymity, lives with her teenage son and baby daughter - and says she is terried in her "extremely dangerous" building in East LondonThe woman says she is scared to stay in the abandoned blockByRuby Gregory:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA single mum-of-two says she sleeps with a kne under her bed at night because she is terried in her extremely dangerous building.The tenant, who is a survivor of domestic abuse and has asked for anonymity, lives with her teenage son and baby daughter,She says the trio are the only people still living in the abandoned block in East London - which leaves her fearing for her safety. The mum, , shares a bed with her son, , and daughter, aged  months, because she doesnapost want her son to be scared at night.She first moved into the property with her son in , reports MyLondon.It was a fresh start for the family, after she fled a violent partner and was homeless.Do you have a similar story  Email webnews@mirror.  However in , she claims she was handed a letter by Clarion Housing explaining she must leave because the entire building was extremely dangerous. She said: I received a letter saying I needed to decamp, the building is extremely dangerous - a housing officer promised me that we would get support. A lot of the tenants were tricked into homes because they were non-English speakers, they didnapost understand the process. They were worried they’d be out on the streets, and now I’m the last one here. The process is by being placed into temporary accommodation or permanent housing found by Clarion. However, the mum is refusing to move into the permanent and temporary accommodation previously offered by Clarion because she fears she will be living in temporary housing with her kids for years. What Clarion do is they lie, they cheat people and put them in temporary accommodation and just leave them there for years - rotting, she alleged. Because the mum rejected Clarionaposs options of living in a crime ridden estate nearby and out of borough in Walthamstow, Clarion served her a notice of possession orderlast March. She says she was horried when a senior housing officer reportedly told her in a later meeting: Itaposs social housing, what do you expect  While suffering a miscarriage a few weeks ago, the mum was notied by Clarion that they will be taking her to court because the six-month notice of their possession order period had ended. She believes Clarion is responsible for her recent miscarriage at nine-and-a-half weeks, and wants to sue them for violating her human rights. Breaking down in tears, the mum said: I was so happy when I moved in - now Iaposm in a really bad state. I don’t want to live in a squalor now, I just don’t want to be living like this. It’s my fourth Christmas stuck here, for New Years we’ll be stuck here - everyone  apart from Clarion tenants will be enjoying themselves. I’m just here on my own, it’s crazy, no neighbours, no one to look out for you, it’s just awful. She claims the communal hallways now reek of urine and gone-off food because no maintenance staff have tended to the building since . While faulty fire alarms means the family are often woken up past midnight to the sound of extremely loud fire alarms. for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information and changes at www.mirror email .On one occasion, firefighters had to break a door down with a crowbar because they couldnapost get in. She also no longer receives post, including vital food vouchers for her toddler. There’s hardly any food in the house, I’m really, really struggling, the mum said. She continued: It’s really hard, everywhere you turn to, they should be safeguarding us, they just turn your back on you - whether it’s the councillor, the local MP, Citizens Advice Bureau, HSC, Environmental Health - they just send emails here and there, things are going round in circles, but nothingaposs being done. It’s really depressing, it’s had a really bad impact on my physical health, I’ve had a miscarriage now because of all of this stress. I don’t sleep at night, I don’t eat. I’m a zombie because I’m working all day. I’ve got a baby that’s  months old who’s sick, I’m on my own and people just don’t have any regard. Inside the two-bed flat, the mum says itaposs extremely stuffy with little air because the windows have never opened very far, while a mice infestation is re. Itaposs taken a toll on the womanaposs teenage son too, who suffers from thalassemia, a blood cell disorder that produces less haemoglobin than usual - causing fatigue and brittle bones. Describing her sonaposs patience, she says: My son has stopped asking me about our situation now as he’s seen how it’s affected me. He sees that and knows it hurts me. He’s a good boy and doesn’t pressurise me much. He says, aposmum don’t worry, we’re not always going to live like this, I promise you I’ll study hard and I’ll get you out of hereapos. Since the pandemic hit, the mum says her housing situation has gone out of control, itaposs also been a struggle to maintain her hair and beauty business - a business sector that was hit hard by Covid-. I’m not expecting luxury like Kensington and Cha, I just want a normal house where me and my kids can heal, she adds. A Clarion spokesperson said: When Lemon Tree House was determined as unsafe in , we worked closely with all residents to find them suitable alternative accommodation. We have offered the resident a number of suitable properties, including both temporary and permanent options. The safety and wellbeing of our residents is our number one priority and there are approved fire safety measures in place in the building. We remain committed to working with the resident to find a permanent home. news uk-news stubborn-dog-refuses-leave-car-"Golden retriever Lenny stubbornly refuses to get out carByTfany LoVideo News ReporterGraeme Murray:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA stubborn golden retriever refused to leave the car despite his owneraposs pleas, a cute video shows.Sam Dawson says her pet pooch Lenny, has a mind of his own and she demonstrated his determination not to exit the vehicle in a video thataposs gone viral on Facebook.The amusing clip, shows the dog remaining on the back seat and just looks a his owner Sam who tells him: Lenny, itaposs time to go inside. Time to go to the house, come on. The animal leans his head against the door frame and blinks a few times but fails to carry out her instructions. Sam gives a gentle pat to her pet and tries again: Letaposs go. Go, come on, Lenny. Get out of the car please. The dog is determined to remain put inside the car despite his owner begging him to get out.Many golden retriever owners found the clip hilarious and described Lennyaposs performance a classic golden move according to the Daily Star.One said: Oh boy, been there, done that. We know whoaposs in charge here.apos Another added: Oh I get it Lenny. Thataposs how I feel about going back to work. Some dog owners agreed their golden retrievers acted exactly the same as Lenny every time they were taken on a car journey. A viewer said: Oh my God, my dog was the same. He just wanted to hang out in the truck so I would leave him there unless it was hot. Another commented: The ride was not long enough. You have to drive around the block again, and again, and again. They are definitely stubborn. But they are lucky they are so damn cute. title: tardis house goes sale 600000
story: Tardis house goes on sale for £, despite being narrower than London busThe one-bed property in Notting Hill, London, is deceptively small from the outside, but once the lucky owner has entered the building, theyll find a surprisingly roomy maisonette over two floorsThe one-bed property in Notting Hill, London is deceptively small from the outside of the property Image: Homesite RightmoveByGraeme Murray:,  Nov A Tardis house has gone on sale for £k despite parts of it being narrower than a London bus. At first glance it looks like a little outbuilding and you wouldnapost expect it to be a house. But the one-bed property in Notting Hill is deceptively small from the outside - similar to Doctor Whoaposs police box Tardis which is actually huge on the inside. And once the lucky owner has entered the building, theyaposll find a surprisingly roomy maisonette over two floors. It has been designed to maximise the space available and both the bedroom and kitchen are slimmer than a London bus. A little living room is the first ting prospective buyers will encounter when they come through the door, complete with a cosy sofa and widescreen TV.  Shelves help maximise the space without bulky furniture. And next to that is sleek, modern kitchen, with hob laid fitted microwave at head height.It is being marketed by Homesite, Notting Hill, on Rightmove aposs property site.The owner, in the fashionable area, has built a breakfast bar below a window. A skylight above, meanwhile, allows plenty of sunshine in and makes the room look bigger.  Agents Homesite say the property is based in Powis Mews, where homes can fetch £.million, and they say it has much to recommend it. The brochure states: Itaposs located a stoneaposs throw away from the market, boutiques and cafes of Portobello Road and Westbourne Grove. Sliding doors take the viewer to the little bedroom which measures just ft in across compared to a Routemaster bus which is ft in wide.  A double bed is lit by pendant-style lightbulbs which shine above the mattress The current owner has not cluttered the home with furniture and instead relies on built-in wardrobes and shelving. The estate agent adds: The apartment has a modern fully fitted kitchen with brand new Siemens appliances. The ground floor level benefits from high ceilings, large sash windows, a skylight and bespoke carpentry with a feature spiral staircase.  The lower ground level consists of a study area with built in wardrobes, a separate bedroom area and family bathroom that has been finished to an exceptional standard. The capital is well-known for its creative solutions to maximise space. One trendy flat in an upscale postcode is on the market for a knock-down price, it was on for a rental price of£ a week. It boasted a large shower, opposite the kitchenette, but there was no toilet to be seen.  Elsewhere, a double room in Finsbury, in north of the city, was on the market for £ a month, but the new tenant had no bedroom It provided a mattress beneath its eaves, with a hammock slung nearby There was also a large garden and a movie room set up. But any renter will need to share with more than  other people, as well as three cats. title: teenager who claims spiked night
story: Teenager who claims she was spiked on night out woke to find human bite mark on armHattie Brown, , said she felt really confused during a night out during which she suffered memory loss. She said she regained consciousness in the toilets of the venueHattie Brown has described regaining consciousness in a night club toilets to find a human bite mark on her arm Image: BPM MEDIAByKaty KeighleyChiara Fiorillo:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA teenager who was claimed she was spiked at a nightclub found a human bite mark on her arm when she regained consciousness. Hattie Brown said she felt really confused during a night out during which she suffered memory loss. The student at Exeter University said when she regained consciousness in the toilets of the venue, she noticed she had been bitten.She told Devon Live : Somehow I lost my friends, I looked around for them, but I don’t remember finding them.I then have a complete memory gap and I remember waking up, or regaining consciousness in the toilets, with my back up against the door.  I was really confused. I looked down at my arm and there were teeth indentations. I saw that I had been bitten by a human and I was really confused because I’ve never really heard of that happening before. I’m assuming that I must have been spiked because I don’t understand how I could have gone from being pretty much sober to having complete memory loss, and how I would have been bitten that hard on the arm without feeling it. She added: It’s one of those things where you will just never understand what was going through the mind of that person and how it happened. Part of me doesn’t want to know what happened, and I’ve kind of accepted that I won’t, but it’s so bizarre.  The -year-old said she is still suffering with bruising, swelling and pain two days later. However, she does not want this experience to stop her from going clubbing in the future and instead wants to warn others hoping it will help them stay safe on nights out. She shared her story on TikTok, gaining over , views, telling people to stay with your mates, let your mates know where you are and where you’re going.  Earlier this month, a university student said she collapsed in an AE waiting room after being allegedly spiked by injection at a nightclub. Amy Taylor said her legs felt fuzzy and her arm was bruised while she started feeling unconscious. The alleged incident happened at Fab aposNapos Halloween Guild of Students club night on October , Birmingham Live reports.The third-year human biology student said she noticed a puncture wound on her arm after being helped into an Uber to AE. She claimed she was spiked at the end of the night, between .am and am. news uk-news thomas-markle-says-meghan-deceived-"Thomas Markle glad the truth is coming out about MeghanByMilo BoydNews ReporterLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Meghan Markleaposs estranged father says she aposdeceivedapos people by claiming she had not giving authorisation to a senior aide to brief the authors of her biography. Thomas Markle slammed his daughter following revelations from her then press secretary Jason Knauf that she was aware about the book Finding Freedom. The Duchess of Sussex said she had not remembered emails between her and Mr Knauf despite a spokesperson for the Sussexes insisting they did not collaborate with the authors on the book, nor were they interviewed for it In a damning interview on GB News on Thursday evening, he claimed: I cant speak to much about this but I think she was trying to deceive.  I think she was telling lies. Finally the truth is coming out and thank god for Jason Knauf. I would like him to come over so I can take him out for a steak. Meghan has apologised in a new witness statement, where she accepted that Mr Knauf did brief the authors of Finding Freedom with Meghanaposs knowledge. She said: I apologise to the Court for the fact that I had not remembered these exchanges at the time. I had absolutely no wish or intention to mislead the Defendant or the Court.  The Duchess added that had she known about the emails she would have been more than happy to refer to them as strongly supportive of her case.In the interview Thomas claimed Meghan had demanded he stopped talking to his two older children and that she had ghosted her family from both sides after marrying Prince Harry.Meghan has claimed that her two older half-siblings Samantha and Thomas had said hurtful things about her in the past.  The interview this evening comes as the Associated Newspapers Limited - the publishers of the Mail on Sunday - appeals against a summary judgement given earlier this year. Meghan had sued the company over five articles that reproduced parts of a personal and private letter sent to her dad in August . The High Court ruled ANLaposs publication of Meghanaposs letter to her father was unlawful, meaning there was no need for a trial. Mr Markle last appeared on British TV screens at the end of October when he was interviewed on Good Morning Britain.  The show was subsequently hit with a  Ofcom complaints by viewers unhappy that he had sounded off about his estranged daughter once again. The Duchess of Sussex has been the subject of a number of cutting remarks from her father and he also tore into Prince Harryaposs new tell-all book, which he branded shameful.  During the attack on the Sussexes Thomas claimed he was being ghosted by Meghan and has vowed to continue to publicly attack his daughter until she begins speaking to him again. I think Harry has abandoned the Queen, the royal family, the British people and the Army. Heaposs abandoned them all, he said on GMB. I’ve made it quite clear until I hear from her until she does speak to me that I’ll continue to do this.  I will do a show for at least a monthI can get it through and eventually sooner or later she should start talking to me - this is way too childish. This is kind of silly. It’s time to talk with each other. We’re family. At one point the retired lighting director said heaposd considered taking legal action in a bid to see his grandchildren, Archie and Lilibet. Some viewers found that suggestion galling. Thereaposs something quite tone deaf about Thomas Markle, one person wrote on social media. Surely youaposd know that your daughter has cut you off because you keep bashing her to the press  How can you be that unaware  The last time Mr Markle went on GB News was back in August this year.  He was asked by Wootton for his response to Meghanaposs comments about him, regarding the infamous paparazzi pictures he staged with an agency before her wedding. The Duchess had, in an interview with Oprah, implied her dad had intentionally caused her pain with the photos. My first response is whataposs going to happen to these children  her dad said. I donapost know what terrible things are going to happen to these children because I did some photos, I donapost know what theyaposre talking about, what Harry is talking about, he kept saying apos you do that only one kid will be protectedapos, not two, I donapost know what heaposs talking about. Why am I being picked on  It seems Iaposm very easily picked on. title: womans horror after uber driver
story: Womans horror after Uber driver performed sex act then police didnt believe herThe woman has claimed she was trapped with a driver in a queue on the M when she felt the car “shaking” and heard a “rubbing noise” before she asked him “are you masturbating”An Uber spokesperson has said the drivers account has been suspended while an investigation takes place Image: PAByBeth Abbit:,  Nov A woman left horried after her Uber driver started “masterbating” while they were stuck in traffic is hitting out at police for allegedly saying her claim was “very doubtful”. The woman claims she was trapped with a driver in a queue on the M when she felt the car “shaking” and heard a “rubbing noise” before she asked him “are you masturbating”. The driver didn’t respond, she said. Feeling uncomfortable, she alleged she got out of the car to seek the help of a nearby police officer. But she says the officer told her he found her claim “very doubtful” and when she askedhe doubted her he simply ‘shrugged his shoulders’. The incident is now being investigated by Greater Manchester Police’s professional standards branch. The force has also apologised for “any instances whereby a member of the public has not received a good service from us”. Uber says they have suspended the driver’s account while an investigation takes place. The woman - who spoke to the Manchester Evening News and has not been named - requested an Uber to take her home from a work event in Manchester city centre just after pm on Thursday night last week.She was sitting in the back seat behind the driver, she said, when the car ground to a halt as they neared a police road closure around the site of an accident. So I was waiting in the taxi trying to chat to the driver and he was a bit grumpy. I put my rucksack on the seat next to me to rest my head,” she said. I noticed the car started shaking and I could hear this rubbing noise. I asked aposwhat are you doing apos. This went on and it stopped and started. I moved to the middle seat to try and distract him and tried to talk to him, asking how long he thought we would be here. I wanted him to stop. I text my husband and said aposIaposm fairly confident the driver of this Uber is masturbatingapos. He phoned me and said to put him on the phone but I didnapost want the driver to take my phone. There was a bit of this starting and stopping and the car shaking and the rubbing noise. I never actually saw his penis, buthe was not doing that he certainly wanted me to think he was. I said aposIaposm getting outapos and asked aposAre you masturbatingapos and he didnapost respond. The woman says she got out of the car onto the motorway and approached a nearby police officer. She explained the situation but was told she needed to get back inside her vehicle. He asked which car it was and started walking me back to the car, she says. I told him I wasnapost getting back in that taxi and he said aposyouaposre going to have to because you canapost stand out in the carriagewayapos. The woman says the officer then aposreluctantlyapos agreed to let her sit in the back of the police car. When she asked what their plan was she was told the officer could drop her at a shopping centre many miles from her home. She was there for around  minutes before anyone spoke to her properly, she says. Sometime later, she says another officer arrived and askedshe would like them to arrest the Uber driver. “I said ‘yeah’,” she says. “They askedI could identy him and I told them the name and car was on my Uber app. I told him what had happened and he told me this case was unlikely to get a prosecution. They had not even taken my name at that point. “By then I was more worried about how I would get home. I said ‘okay, leave it’. Then the first officer came over tomy phone and said ‘I find it very doubtful that a man would do this whilst he knows he’s trapped in the traffic’. “I said ‘are you telling me this didn’t happen’ and he just shrugged his shoulders and passed me the phone.” The woman says officers dropped her at McDonald’s, in Hattersley, where her husband had ordered her a cab home. She has since reported both the alleged crime and her complaint about officers’ conduct. They said there would be an investigation and I would get a written outcome,” she says. In my opinion that is quite a dangerous officer because he is not only inept and didnapost take a report, but he also tried to get me back in the taxi,” she added. From that driveraposs perspective heaposs seen me go to the police and seen them try to put me back in his car. If I had not been so insistent I could have ended back in that Uber. And someone  with perhaps less le experience might have. It was a sex crime. I was in a position where I was vulnerable, I told a police officer and you think they would at least get you home safe. A spokesperson for the Greater Manchester Police force said: Firstly, we completely acknowledge the effect incidents of this nature can have on victims, and we are sorry for any instances whereby a member of the public has not received a good service from us. Our job as police officers is to keep the public safe. We want all members of our community, especially women and girls, to feel they are not at risk of harm when going about their daily lives in Greater Manchester and we are working with partners across Greater Manchester to better achieve this. We can confirm that GMP has received a complaint regarding the police response to this incident which is in the process of being assessed by our Professional Standards Branch. “As a result it would be inappropriate for us to comment further at this time. An Uber spokesperson said: We are appalled by this allegation and have a zero tolerance policy on any such behaviour in the Uber community. “In this case the driveraposs account has been suspended while an investigation takes place.” Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Greater Manchester PoliceAppsPolice carShopping centresCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: adoptive parents girl 6 who
story: Adoptive parents of girl, , who said she wandered off during night charged with murderIsabella Kalua was reported missing on September , but authorities believe the little girl was in fact murdered a month before and have arrested her adoptive parents on suspicion of her deathIsabella Kalua was reported missing in September but police now believe she was killed in AugustByKate BuckNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov The adoptive parents of a missing six-year-old girl have been charged with her murder, police have said. Isaac Kalua, , and Lehua Kalua, , reported Isabella Kalua missing two months ago, claiming she had wandered off in the middle of the night, but despite a massive search effort she still hasnapost been found. Honolulu interim Police Chief Rade Vadic told a news conference the pair are being held without bail on suspicion of second degree murder. He added: Unfortunately what began as a search for a missing girl turned into a murder investigation. We believe that the evidence leads to the Kaluas and no one . The Kaluas adopted the little girl in January, it is understood, and legally changed her name from Ariel Sellers. When they reported Isabella missing on September  it sparked a massive search effort in Honolulu, Hawaii, where they live. But detectives have said they believe Isabella was killed in August, around a month before she was reported missing. The Kaluas were arrested by armed police who stormed the home where they live with their other children. Officers set off flash bangs brought Lehua Kalua out in handcuffs.Her husband Isaac Kalua was later arrested at his workplace of the Pearl Harbor shipyard, WAGMTV reports. Homicide Lt. Deena Thoemmes said police believed some of the information which the couple gave was  and added: There were some things that werenapost adding up for us.  She added that the pair were initially cooperative with police, until they stopped contacting them. They did open their home initially to us, provided us statements. But then as the weeks passed, there was no call back to us, she said.Authorities have refused to say what prompted police to name the Kaluas as suspects, NBC news reports. Police were seen carrying out a search in their home on Wednesday for evidence, although no body has been found.  Authorities declined to say what evidence prompted police to identy the Kaluas as suspects, nor would they comment on a potential motive. They have asked anyone who interacted with the little girl in the months leading to her disappearance to contact police. lice asked anyone who interacted with the girl or her sisters in the months leading up to her disappearance to contact authorities. There is an , reward still being offered for information which leads to her discovery.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON MurderCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: boy becomes worlds most premature
story: Boy becomes worlds most premature baby to survive after being born  weeks earlyTwin Curtis Means, who is now a healthy -month-old, was delivered in Birmingham, Alabama, in the US, last year weighing just gImage: GUINNESS WORLD RECORDSByMirror:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov " data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _THP_CHP_Slug_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"facebook|share|top"" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _THP_CHP_Slug_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top"" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _THP_CHP_Slug_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"| commentsA boy has been certied as the most premature baby to survive after being born close to  weeks early weighing less than a pound. Twin Curtis Means, who is now a healthy -month-old, was delivered in Birmingham, Alabama, in the US, last year weighing just g .The average weight of a newborn is around . lb , while a full-term pregnancy is usually  weeks. Guinness World Records has now confirmed that Curtis, who was  days - nearly  weeks - premature, set the new record. His mother, Michelle Butler, scrambled to get to the hospital after being into labour on July  , amid Independence Day celebrations.  Michelle gave birth to twins, Curtis and C’Asya, at lunchtime the next day. Little C’Asya tragically died a day later. However, Curtis beat the odds, clinging on in intensive care. Dr Brian Sims, who was the attending physician, said statistically, children born as young as the twins had virtually no chance of survival. In a statement from the University of Alabama at Birmingham, which operates the hospital, Dr Sims said doctors typically advised “compassionate care” in situations of extremely preterm births.  This allows the parents to hold their babies and cherish what little time they may have together.”But instead, Curtis grew stronger by the day and was thriving,the BBC reported.He received help from therapists to learn to breathe and to use his mouth to eat, and after  days, was eventually taken off a ventilator and discharged from hospital.  Mrs Butler, of rural Eutaw, Alabama, said in a statement: Being able to finally take Curtis home and surprise my older children with their younger brother is a moment I will always remember. While Curtis, the youngest of four, still needs supplemental oxygen and a feeding tube, doctors say he is in good health. Dr Sims, who oversaw the delivery, told Guinness World Records: Iaposve been doing this almost  years, but Iaposve never seen a baby this young be as strong as he was. There was something special about Curtis. Curtis cut a whole  hours off the previous record. Wisconsin baby Richard Hutchinson was born just a month prior, at  weeks and two days. The record had remained unbroken before Richard’s birth for  years, with the previous record holder being a baby boy born in Ottawa, Canada, at  weeks and five days. title: female construction manager says no
story: Female construction manager says no-one takes her seriously because of her looksTikTok user Autumn Westfall, who works in a construction company as a project manager in the US, says she was treated like a tea girl and her colleagues ignored her emailsAutumn Westfall is a project manager in commercial construction as well as a model Image: Autumn Westfall TikTokByTfany LoVideo News Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA woman has opened up about working as a construction manager in a male-dominated industry and being treated dferently because of her looks. Autumn Westfall says she was treated like a tea girl and her colleagues ignored her emails. Sharing her experiences on TikTok, the mum from from Macomb, Michigan, talked about pretty privilege and said it does exist.But while everyone assumes it gives you an advantage in le, there is apparently the opposite side of it too, the Daily Star reports.It is absolutely rude how when people find you attractive, they are generally just nice to you for that reason and that reason only, Autumn explains. Until you are in a power position who steps into a male-dominated industry and then you might as well be carrying around a tray of coffee and snacks. Autumn says in her case, she is often ignored by her co-workers because of the way she looks. She continued: Pretty privilege almost becomes the opposite in my experience. So the logicyou have nice hair, you have your makeup done, you have a nice outfit, you possibly couldnapost be in a power position or any intelligence whatsoever. For me I work in construction management on multi-million dollar jobs and I canapost tell you how fun it is to have my emails ignored, people literally talk to my male co-worker to act like Iaposm just there to serve them. Some people shared their similar experiences and said they were taken seriously when they went to work makeup-free. But Autumn said she get glammed up because it makes her happy, feel good and perform better. Getting my hair and makeup done makes me feel professional, it makes me feel aposI can get the job doneapos and thataposs what exactly Iaposm going to do, she added. I have two daughters and by the time they are choosing what career path they want go in, I want them to decide without worryingthey are going to be talked down to orthey are going to be treated professionally. I donapost want that to be an issue for them. news us-news meghan-markle-stuns-gushes-over-"Prince Harry and Meghan at military awards veterans galaByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments Meghan Markle stunned in a red dress as she arrived with Prince Harry for an military veterans event - just hours after bombshell new evidence was heard in her privacy court case. The Duchess of Sussex, , smiled for the cameras as she glided across the red carpet in New York City. Meghan appeared in a flowing long dress at this year’s Salute to Freedom Gala at the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum. She was holding hands with her husband Harry, , who looked dashing wearing a dinner jacket, bow tie and military medals. But just hours earlier - and some , miles away - the Court of Appeal in London had learned more about the writing of the bestseller Finding Freedom.  A statement from Meghan, read to the court, claimed emails between her then press secretary Jason Knauf about a meeting with the authors of the book, Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand, had slipped her mind. In a statement, Mr Knauf noted that Meghan and Harry authorised specic cooperation in writing in December . He had advised the couple that putting the authors in touch with Meghanaposs friends was not a good idea, emails show. Being able to say hand on heart that we did not facilitate access will be important, he told the pair. A witness statement from Meghan then said she accepted that Mr Knauf did brief the authors of Finding Freedom - with her knowledge. She said: I apologise to the Court for the fact that I had not remembered these exchanges at the time.  I had absolutely no wish or intention to mislead the Defendant or the Court. The Duchess added that had she known about the emails she would have been more than happy to refer to them as strongly supportive of her case. Last year a spokesperson for the couple said they did not collaborate with the authors on the book, nor were they interviewed for it, OK reports. Despite the dayaposs revelations, the pair put on a united front on the red carpet. When a reporter asked Meghanshe was proud of Prince Harry, she replied: Iaposm always proud of him.  Harry later joked in a speech at the event that he is now living the American Dream. He said: “It’s wonderful to be back on USS Intrepid a decade after my last visit – and a lot has changed since then. Just last week, I went for a ride on the Oscar Mayer Wienermobile – how’s that for living the American dream. Each year the museum pays tribute to people in the military who have shown “extraordinary leadership” and honours the roles they have played to defend their country.  Harry continued: I’ve lived in the US for close to two years now. I have to say, witnessing your support for all those that put themselves in harm’s way in defence of our freedoms and liberties – it’s remarkable and hugely respected. “It reminds me of the deep reverence us Brits have for our military as well. The armed forces communities in both our countries share a special bond, and I’m grateful to have served in support of our joint allyship for many years.” Meghan was wearing a red Carolina Herrera dress and red shoes to match the high-slit fashion choice. She had her long locks up into a high bun. Harry had a line of four medals on his jacket along with the cross for Knight Commander of Royal Victorian Order around his neck. Palace rules mean Harry can wear medals on his jacket but was stripped of his titles after deciding to leave for the US. He was reportedly particularly upset to have the rank of Captain General of the Royal Marines taken from him. As they moved along the red carpet, it was Harry who appeared more keen to stop and chat. He was overheard to ask one person: Are you excited  Then a reporter asked him: Howaposs your grandmother  He smiled and nodded before moving on.  The Sussexes, parents to Archie, two, and five-month-old Lilibet, were both wearing a poppy. The event is held ahead of Veterans Day in the US and Remembrance Day in the UK. Harry is a special guest at the event where he will give out medals for the Intrepid Valor Awards to five service members, veterans and military families who are living with the “invisible wounds of war”. The event is particularly relevant for Harry who himself had a military background before leaving the Royal Family and moving to Calornia.  He served in the military for  years including two tours of Afghanistan and has been working with veterans as well as founding the Invictus Games - a sporting event for wounded for ex-servicemen. Harry and Meghan have been dedicating their time to charity work and humanitarian initiatives since moving to the US. Also at the veteransapos event was Jon Bon Jovi who collaborated with Harry to release a song for the Invictus Games and he received the  Intrepid Letime Achievement Award for his work as chairman of the Jon Bon Jovi Soul Foundation.We are so grateful to Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex for honouring and amplying the stories of these heroes and helping to raise awareness for mental health support for our men and women in unorm, said Susan Marenoff-Zausner, president of the Intrepid Museum. This is their second trip to New York this year having attended the Global Citizen Live concert in Manhattan in late September. Harry has spoken out recently about the trolling of Meghan online, including over the decision by the couple to leave the UK for the US that became dubbed “Megxit”. He reportedly told the Wired’s Re:Wired Conference on Tuesday that the “term ‘Megxit’ was or is a misogynistic term and it was created by a troll, amplied by royal correspondents and it grew and grew and grew into mainstream media.”  Meghan meanwhile has said she is now feeling much better after admitting she suffered suicidal thoughts while pregnant with son Archie. The Duchess of Sussex was speaking to host Andrew Ross Sorkin at the New York Times DealBook Summit where she said stepping back from royal duties has lead to an improvement in her mental health. Mr Sorkin said there was a moment when a lot of the world was concerned and wondering about the comments she made. Meghan told an interview with Oprah Winfrey earlier this year, she had suicidal thoughts while a member of the Royal Family living in the UK.  She also alleged racism by a royal who asked her what would be the colour of her child when she was pregnant for the first time. She responded to the host that she was now feeling “better about everything. Just days ago royal biographer Andrew Morton revealed the Oprah interview was planned years in advance, shortly after the Sussexes got married. The Sussexesapos rt with the Royal Family led to them moving to the United States last year and since then they have spoken regularly to American media about problems they allege forced them to leave. news weird-news cinema-worker-leaves-people-mortied-"Cinema worker can see people doing the nasty on CCTVByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsCinemagoers beware - staff are aware of all the naughty things you get up to while visiting the flicks. For most of us, that boils down to sneaking in our own snacks, in a bid to stop a trip to the cinema from becoming prohibitively expensive. But for some risk-takers, it appears that they use their time during the film for X-rated acts - which is strictly forbidden. Now one cinema worker has gone viral after revealing how staff members can see exactly whataposs going on in the theatre. And it isnapost pretty. TikTok user @.noheadache went viral after sharing a video where she admitted sheaposs constantly having to look away from the CCTV screen because of some coupleaposs outrageous behaviour.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Zooming in on the screen showing all the cinema rooms, she explained: “When people come to the cinema with their sneaky link to do the nasty.” The video, which has racked up more than  million views, is captioned: “We see everything.” The worker explained further in the comments: “We also have night vision goggles so we’ve seen it all.” In the comments, one user explained: Theyaposre for anti-piracy. Theatre hire guards for pre-screening to make sure they donapost film. They probably use them for internal use too. Viewers were left stunned - with many admitting they had no idea staff could see them eating their own food into the cinema.One wrote: “I donapost care about that. Iaposm just concerned because Iaposve been throwing popcorn at the back of peopleaposs heads for fun. Another added: “Youaposre telling me the time I snuck in a large pizza theyaposve been watching me eat   ” Well this is news to me,” a third wrote. A fourth asked: “How do people not know this  This is actually good to know in case of emergencies. I honestly had no idea, I thought you could get away with murder in there lol, commented another. One viewer joked: The only thing I be sneaky with is my snacks and food. title: hotel worker says you should
story: Hotel worker says you should avoid the complimentary breakfast at all costsIn a viral Tik Tok warning, the former hotel worker said that budget accommodation will cut corners wherever possible - and that the food served is made in a dirty kitchen and comprises of cheap ingredientsA hotel worker said you should never eat the free breakfast at a hotel Image: Getty Images Cultura RFByJohn BettAudience WriterJames RodgerRegional Content Editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA former hotel worker has lted the lid on budget accommodation kitchens - and said that you should avoid the full English at all costs.Brandi Augustus, who posts on TikTok as @brandiaugustus, claims to have worked at several hotels and said that the kitchens in budget chains are the worst. She said that corners are cut when it comes to cleaning, and that staff donapost give a s**t about the free fried breakfast that is offered by many hotels, as Birmingham Live reports.She said ingredients get reused and cooking equipment isnapost properly cleaned, but instead is just wiped down each day - leaving the dirt and grime to build up.  What do you think about cheap hotel breakfasts  Let us know in the comments...In her video, Brandi said: I don’t know how to say this without being attacked by people in the industry...your hotel serves the hot continental breakfast, eggs, waffles stuff like that, don’t eat that s***. That waffle batter gets reused until it starts to smell like beer. Another gross thing Brandi recalled was being told by a manager to only use a single paper towel to clean everything all night. She explains: He said it was environmentally friendly instead of using a rag or a sponge or even mostly paper towels to clean things like bowls, spatulas, the tables.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Brandi saysyou do want to stay somewhere and eat breakfast, make sure the hotel employs a proper chef and has a hygienic kitchen. I’m just trying to save y’all a headache, she adds. The video was watched more than , times since Brandi uploaded it on Thursday, November , and it proved to be a controversial topic in the comments. One viewer said: I have worked in the food industry for over  years. Mostly worked as a morning hotel chef or manager. The buffet eggs are a no-go. A second person, who claimed to work for a popular hotel, commented: Stick to the prepackaged foods, also check the room before you bring luggage in. Not put off by the video, another person wrote: Girl itaposs free bye.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. doorbell camera filmed a apostriangular UFO apos flying over his home - and the footage shows a trio of lights moving slowly across the sky.Matt Doughty, , was watching TV with his friend Kevin Barritt last month when his phone pinged with a notication from his smart doorbell, warning something was outside his front door. He then played the captured footage and was amazed as he watched the eerie scene unfold, with an unidentied flying object gliding through the sky with three bright lights beaming through the darkness. Logistics manager Matt then called his aviation buff dad who checked an online flight tracker and claimed there was aposno plane trafficapos in the sky at all - leaving him to questionit could be extraterrestrial le. What do you think about Mattaposs sighting  Let us know in the comments...Matt, from St Albans, Hertfordshire, said: I was sat with my friend and said aposblimey, I didnapost hear the doorbell go but Iaposve got an alert come upapos. I looked at the footage and played it back. It was silent. Three lights came from the sky and I thought it was really weird. Where itaposs come through the trees, itaposs come over the house opposite me then the footage captures it coming from right to left. It disappears over the top of woodland to the left of my house.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. It was a bit of a chilling feeling really - I thought aposoh my god, thataposs quite closeapos. I wonderedIaposd discovered something nobody knows anything about. When I showed Kevin he said aposjeez, that looks like a UFOapos. news weird-news my-date-only-bought-food-"Date refuses to buy woman food because she had no cashByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments When it comes to personal relationships, itaposs healthy to set expectations and boundaries.And while the apps can be useful for helping you meet a wide range of people, itaposs only when you meet in person that you knowyou have a personal connection or not. We all certain things weaposre looking for from a partner - and values we want them to uphold. They might be political or personal - with many Brits vowing to never date someone with opposing political views. But one woman sparked a debate on social media after revealing that her date didnapost cover her meal after she forgot to bring cash - and askedshe should see him again.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here In a viral TikTok, she explained in subtitles that this was their first date and that she had asked him out. But she didnapost bring any cash, and explained: I didn’t have money, so he only bought himself food.”The woman, who goes by the name of @heydiberber, then showed the man enjoying his meal, while she just sat there awkwardly, with nothing in front of her.She asked her for opinions on whether she should “Go out with him again , and explained: “He said pay me or pay me no attention.” And she indicated her displeasure after liking a post which said: A gentleman wonapost do you like that.The video racked up more than three million views, and her followers didnapost hold back, with many left ided on the topic. One woman commented: If he asked you out, then he should be buying. If you asked him out, it would be on you. You asking is a huge red flag. Another wrote: I personally offer to pay on the first date but knowing your date came expecting a freebie...should he go out again is the question. You should always have money for emergencies, whathe left you there  asked another. news weird-news time-traveller--predicts-alien-"‘Time traveller from ’ proves hes ‘last person on Earth’ByMalvika Padin:,  Nov | commentsA self-proclaimed TikTok time traveller predicted that a meteor shower would hit Earth bringing aliens along with it in a horrying prophecy. This isnapost the first time that the account, aesthetictimewarper, has posted such a prediction in a bid to apossaveapos humanity.The account has already made plenty of other predictions about the Earth, Daily Star reports.In July, they asked us to note five dates and events towards the end of  and . The time traveller believes that three teens will open a portal to an alternate universe using a T. Rex dinosaur egg in December. They also say that the mythical sunken city of Atlantis will be found in the Atlantic Ocean in , housing human-fish le.  The account also claimed that NASA would find a mirrored Earth in August and that eight humans would receive superpowers from the extreme energy of the Sun in October. One of the accountaposs predictions that caught a lot of attention was a clip that suggested that “something amazing happens on August , .” They said: There will be a very large meteor shower that lasts for  weeks, it will be seen in the Northern hemisphere, containing the Nozic Message. One of the meteors will seem dferent than all the others, that is because it is a ship landing on Earth, starting preparations for the first Nozic War.” Many were quick to voice their opinion on the theory, with one user even calling out the TikToker whose account has over . million likes and , followers, writing: First thing I would do as a time traveller: create a TikTok. A second user joked that it was “going to happen right when they turn on that G,” with another person adding Nothing heaposs said has come true. Tell us something legit. The account has had its fair share of hate, and hit back saying: Many of you still donapost believe I am a real time traveller, so remember these five dates.Earlier this week, a man who claims to be a time traveller from  shared video footage of a deserted city as proof that heaposs the aposlast person on Earthapos.He claims to be stuck alone in the future as the rest of the earthaposs population has been wiped out by a disaster, and he uploads videos of the Spanish city he is in as proof. title: wealthy family offer 9000 nanny
story: Wealthy family offer £, for nanny that can work two weeks - but theres a catchIf youve not got much on over Christmas, and have experience working as a nanny, this well-paid job could be perfect for you - but you will have to miss seeing family and friendsIf youre not bothered about Christmas, this could be the job for you Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsHow much would you be willing to take on for two weeks infor £, A wealthy family in the UK are looking for a nanny to look after their five-year-old twins over Christmas and New Year – for a whopping £,.The job offers signicantly over the average UK salary, with the successful candidate earning over £ per day. But you really will be working for your money - as applicants must be willing to give up seeing their own family over the festive season and be on hand   between December  and January . The job ad says the family will be located in a castle close to Edinburgh, where they will be staying for the Christmas holidays. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here It added the nanny would be responsible for dressing and washing the children as well as reading to them and taking them through a bedtime routine. They will also be in charge of ‘generally ensuring children are entertained’, with possible activities including outdoor walks, games, crafts and day trips with the family’s driver. Cooking and cleaning will not fall within the new nanny’s remit. Applicants must be fully vaccinated and will require a background check and references. They will also need at least five years of experience and will have to sign a non-disclosure agreement. The job ad, on Jobs in Childcare says: Seeking a nanny to take care of twins age in East Lothian. The family will be spending the duration in a castle with extended family and require a nanny from nd Dec to th Jan inclusive. Nanny will be on duty   with a room adjoining the childrenaposs.Background check and references essential. At least  years of experience. Nanny will be required to sign an NDA. Transport refunded plus flat-rate salary of £. Nanny must be fully vaccinated. Previously, one mumaposs advert for a live-in nanny went viral - with many shocked by the demands the employee would face.Applicants would have to share a bedroom with the baby, but go where every weekend. And expect to work ten hours a day, but stay later up to three times a week - sparking jokes that not even Mary Poppins would fancy that job. title: wedding photographer claims can tell
story: Wedding photographer claims she can tell when a marriage is doomed from day oneWedding photographer Shayla Herrington has witnessed enough people tying the knot to tell which couples will go the distance and those who wontShayla learned about the indicators from a senior wedding photographer Image: @shaylamherrington TikTokByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | comments Whenever a couple ties the knot, itaposs fair to assume theyaposre doing so in the belief they will always be together. But, in actual fact, around  percent of marriages end in orce, proving this is sadly not the case. It most instances you would assume itaposs impossible to tell whether the couple will go the distance, but according to a wedding photographer, the signs of future orce bells are a lot less subtle than youaposd think.Shayla Herrington recently took to TikTok to share the three signs that a marriage is doomed from the very beginning, according to a wedding photographer of more than  years, who shared their wisdom with her.Posting from the handle @shaylamherrington, Shayla explained: One time I was shooting under this wedding photographer, and they told me they can always tella couple will last or not, based on three things.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Mind you this photographer has been in the industry for  or  years, so I was really interested to hear their theory on this, she added. The first sign, Shayla explained, isone of the spouses takes more than three photos without their partner - which actually makes a lot of sense,you think about it. This one kinda makes sense to me, just because you might get a few with your mom and dad, but to kick them out of more than three photos, seems a little suspicious, she explained. The second indicator is the bridesmaids, or the groomsmen will avoid talking about the spouse when they are getting ready or doing toast or anything, which she explained typically means they donapost like the spouse. And finally, Shayla revealed that the third indicator the marriage will not last is when the couple spend more time with family and friends than with each other during the day. The photographer then questioned her followers over whether they believed these indicators to be true, and many shared their own experiences of weddings and orce. Yep. My ex-husband didnapost spend time with me at the wedding, and his groomsmen didnapost say hi to me at all, one TikTok user commented, while another added: It depends. My husband didnapost even MEET half my family until the wedding day so there wasnapost that relationship between him and my family.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it.
